page.title: 05METHODIST MINISTER,PORTESSIE
page.content: MR. DAVID ARCHER IS THE MINISTER OF PORTESSIE AND BANFF METHODIST CHURCHES. HE CAME TO PORTESSIE IN AUGUST 1979. HE BECAME A MINISTER BECAUSE HE BELIEVES GOD CALLED HIM TO DO THIS WORK. HE TRAINED FOR FIVE YEARS FIRST AT COLLEGE AND THEN IN CHURCHES. A MINISTER'S DAY IS VERY VARIED. IN THE MORNINGS, HE STUDIES, DOES ADMINISTRATION AND PREPARES HIS SERVICES. AFTERNOONS ARE SPENT VISITING IN THE HOMES AND HOSPITAL. EVENINGS ARE SPENT AT MEETINGS OR VISITING. PORTESSIE CHURCH HAS 147 MEMBERS. AMONG THE ORGANISATIONS ARE THE CHOIR, LADIES' GROUP, SUNDAY SCHOOL AND JUNIOR AND PRE-JUNIOR SECTIONS OF THE BOYS' BRIGADE COMPANY. MR. ARCHER IS A CHAPLAIN TO THE SCHOOL. {BY JOHN BOWMAN.
